newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Earthquake causes stampede in central Philippines.
newsitem.headline: Earthquake causes stampede in central Philippines.

text.p: A sharp earthquake jolted the central Philipine city of Tacloban on Wednesday, triggering a stampede in some buildings but there were no immediate reports of casualty or damage, residents said.

"It was quite strong. All of my staff, about 25 of us, ran out of the building. But all of us are safe," Dalmacio Grafil, publisher of the Leyte-Samar Weekly Express newspaper, said by telephone from Tacloban, a city of about 200,000 people.
People in restaurants in the city centre also ran out into the streets, radio reports said.
Government seismologists in Manila said they were still collecting data to find out how strong the tremor was.
